dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: THE CHURCH IS THE BRIDE OF CHRIST

kernfrasen: look through the window of our faith

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The oil of the lamps is the witness of the Spirit

cognitieve_implicaties: Faith requires a 'fuel' that can be depleted
Preparedness is internal and cannot be shared at the last minute
theologische_implicaties: The Holy Spirit provides the capacity for endurance
Grace is mediated through the 'storage' of spiritual disciplines
ethische_implicaties: Believers must practice 'storing up' through worship and study before the crisis hits
onbedoelde_consequenties: Suggests faith is a commodity that can run out

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of 'oil' by linking it specifically to the historical resilience of the Black Church and the 'DNA' of a community.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a tight dialectic between 'waiting' and 'hastening' (Barthian influence). It successfully bridges the ancient parable with the contemporary tragedy in Charleston by using the 'night' as a shared source domain for both the parable and racial suffering.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The transition from the 'untrammeled joyousness' of a wedding to the 'horribly violated church' is jarring.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: The 'Bridegroom' brings joy, but the 'thief in the night' (implied by the tragedy) brings death.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses 'DNA' to explain how the 'oil' (Spirit) becomes an intrinsic part of the community's character over generations.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the 'waiting' metaphor by applying it to the 'long night' of racial injustice.
sterktes.voorbeeld: They’ve been in the middle of the night for a long time.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses CMT to move from moralism (sharing oil) to ontology (being ready).
sterktes.voorbeeld: That’s a moralistic reading of the story.

risicos.beschrijving: The distinction between 'virgins' and 'bridesmaids' risks distracting from the conceptual mapping of the church.
risicos.voorbeeld: I guess bridesmaids aren’t virgins any more...
risicos.potentiele_impact: Loss of focus on the eschatological target domain.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The dark Palestinian night awaiting a wedding procession.
sub_worlds: The courtyard of Mother Emanuel Church in Charleston

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Powerful; it grounds the abstract 'waiting' in a concrete, modern struggle.

versterkte_schemas.schema_naam: The Church as a Witnessing Community
versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing the collective 'readiness' of Mother Emanuel over individual effort.

verstoorde_schemas.schema_naam: God as Life Coach / Human Hope
verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Critiquing 'exclusively human hope' and 'the triumph of the human spirit'.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Apocalyptic Divine Agency ('will be made right')

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with the Advent/Eschatological tension of the 'Long Green Season'.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the JOURNEY and CONTAINER domains. Faith is depicted as a 'stored' substance (oil) that enables one to 'hasten' through a dark 'time between'. The preacher masterfully avoids the ECONOMIC domain (transactional forgiveness) in favor of a RELATIONAL/PARTICIPATORY domain ('With him!').

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'procession' aspect—the movement of light into darkness.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The Bridegroom is not just a person, but the 'Light of the World' breaking the midnight of injustice.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The 'Thief in the night' vs. 'Bridegroom' tension.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly link the 'unexpectedness' of the Bridegroom to the 'suddenness' of the tragedy to unify the 'Night' schema.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests those who 'run out' are simply lazy.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that the 'oil' is a gift of the Spirit, not just a human achievement of 'Bible study'.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To address the 'brokenness' of society mentioned by the principal.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: Sanctification as the healing of the 'broken' social body.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how CMT can bridge the gap between ancient text and modern trauma without falling into platitudes.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Instead of just praising the 'beauty' of the wedding imagery, CMT reveals how the 'oil' metaphor functions as a cognitive battery for endurance.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'experience/reflection' to show how the very structure of the hearer's 'Time' is reshaped by the Advent schema.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that 'forgiveness' is being treated by the media as a 'human spirit' resource, while the preacher re-maps it as a 'divine oil' stored in the container of the church.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Bondage to the power of Sin
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on Karl Barth's dialectical theology to provide the conceptual framework for the 'Journey' metaphors.
